result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregg B. Kandutsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol;

No bars, liquor stores, taverns or beer tents.

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent;

DNA sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregg B. Kandutsch

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:23 a.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ with Attorney Natasha VanLieshout;

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1: OWI (7th) >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 8 years Wisconsin Prison System (4 years IC; 4 years ES); CONDITIONS OF ES: $3,976.00 fine inclusive; 36 months driver's license revocation; 36 months IID, 6 points; Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol; No bars, liquor stores, taverns or beer tents; AODA and f/u; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC. 31 days jail credit. Defendant eligible for ERP.

Adj: 9:50 a.m.
Plea hearing on July 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADA Hannah Boeck appears in person; Attorney Vanlieshout appears in person
DATES: 
TPD/JPTC: 7/26/22 at 9:15 am

Clerk Micki. 
Case called: 3:46p.m.

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.

CONDITIONS: 
No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
No driving without valid DL. 
Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
